text: Kincaid is a city in Anderson County, Kansas, United States. In 2020, 103 people lived there. ==History== Kincaid was created in 1885. It was named after Robert Kincaid, of Mound City. ==Geography== Kincaid is at (38.083502, -95.153612). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of . All of it is land. ==People== ===2020 census=== The 2020 census says that there were 103 people, 46 households, and 28 families living in Kincaid. Of the households, 73.9% owned their home and 26.1% rented their home. The median age was 42.3 years. Of the people, 91.3% were White, 2.9% were Black, 1.0% were Native American, and 4.9% were two or more races. None were Hispanic or Latino. ===2010 census=== The 2010 census says that there were 122 people, 56 households, and 30 families living in Kincaid. ==Government== The Kincaid has a mayor and five council members. The council meets the 2nd Monday of each month at 7PM.Kincaid - Directory of Public Officials * City Hall, 500 5th Ave. ==Education== Kincaid is part of Unified School District 479.USD 479 ==References== ==More reading== * The History Of Anderson County, Kansas, From Its First Settlement To The Fourth Of July, 1876; W.A.
